Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant with water and light, showing it growing and healthy.
The student can draw a plant without water, showing it wilting or not growing well.
The student can draw a plant without light, showing it wilting or not growing well.
The student can illustrate the importance of water for plant growth by depicting the difference between a well-watered plant and a wilting plant.
The student can illustrate the importance of light for plant growth by depicting the difference between a plant with sunlight and one kept in the dark.
The student can include in their drawing comparisons of how plants look when they do and do not have necessary resources (water and light).
The student can demonstrate observing patterns in plant health based on the availability of water and light.
